Posts.Content: worriednlost wrote:  Has anyone been diagnosed with the same condition? Really worried about the PET/CT scan. After reading about e-cadherin It scares me even more. My mom's dad died from stomach cancer, I realized that there might be a connection to CDH1. If anyone has experienced this terrible diagnosis I would like to hear your advice and story.  Thank You. aggressive triple negative Invasive ductal carcinoma with lobular features  (CDH1 e-cadherin positive, focally showing incomplete membrane staining) TAC chemo X6 started July 15th finished Nov 5 -/- 4cm x 4cm mass -/- IDC with lobular features -/- BRCA1/BRCA2 negative -/- MX with 11 nodes -/- Pathological Complete Response after chemo and surgery Dx 7/8/2011, IBC, 4cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: aggressive triple negative IDC and CDH1 e-cadherin positive worriednlost worriednlost

Posts.Content: worriednlost wrote: Hi everyone.. I would like to know if someone can help me maybe interpret the results of a mammogram. My mom is 54 years old. She will be seen by a doctor in 4 days and I am very worried. She discovered a lump about 3 weeks ago. After that she had another mammo done which determined it was a 4cm mass. The mass grew very quickly since it was not there last year. Here is what mammo report said: BILATERAL MAMMOGRAM   Patient complains of left breast pain and a mass. In the left breast, in the inferior medial quadrant, an irregular non-calcified 4cm mass with  two associated oval nodular asymmetries new since April 2010. The 10mm focal asymmetry on the inferior medial quadrant evident April 2010 remains stable. Cancer is likely.   The 10mm was ruled as a cyst and was also checked by US in may 2010.  Nothing problematic was found on the right breast. Report also suggested US and a Biopsy.   Should I really be worried ?    Thanks for reading  TAC chemo X6 started July 15th finished Nov 5 -/- 4cm x 4cm mass -/- IDC with lobular features -/- BRCA1/BRCA2 negative -/- MX with 11 nodes -/- Pathological Complete Response after chemo and surgery Dx 7/8/2011, IBC, 4cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 1/11 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Need help understanding mammo results.. worriednlost barbe1958
